intro: Oligochaetochilus macrosceles, commonly known as the large-stemmed feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like foliage and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a rhizoid system that helps anchor it to substrates and absorb nutrients from the surrounding soil. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores for propagation. Oligochaetochilus macrosceles plays a vital ecological role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its habitat.
